meanings.sent1: The three sons played in the park.
meanings.sent2: He has two sons and a daughter.
meanings.sent3: The sons raced each other to the finish line.
meanings.sent4: His sons were like young lions, full of energy and playfulness.
meanings.sent5: The sons' laughter filled the house with joy.

meanings.sent1: The great-great-grandsons of the king inherited the throne.
meanings.sent2: She traced her lineage back to her Viking sons.
meanings.sent3: The sons of the ancient warrior were known for their bravery.
meanings.sent4: The sons of the pioneers carried on their legacy.
meanings.sent5: The sons of the pharaohs were believed to be divine.

meanings.definition: A male person considered as a child of a particular parent or family.
meanings.sent1: He treated his apprentice like a son.
meanings.sent2: The sons of the tribe's chief were respected by all.
meanings.sent3: The sons of the forest animals gathered for a meeting.
meanings.sent4: The sons of the sea god were known for their swimming skills.
meanings.sent5: The sons of the mountain were said to be strong and resilient.
